CheckTitle: Ensure Connection Filter Safe List is Disabled
Description: Checks if the EnableSafeList property in the Default Hosted Connection Filter Policy is set to False.
Risk: If EnableSafeList is enabled, it may allow unwanted or risky senders to bypass anti-spam protections.

Code.Other: 1. Go to Microsoft 365 Defender (https://security.microsoft.com). 2. Expand Email & collaboration > Policies & rules > Threat policies. 3. Under Policies, select Anti-spam. 4. Edit the Default policy and disable the Safe List.

Recommendation.Text: Disable the Safe List in the Default Hosted Connection Filter Policy unless there is a specific, justified need.

Notes: This check validates that the Safe List is disabled in the Default Hosted Connection Filter Policy.
